descriptions.description: More core developers increase the availability of mentors, facilitating implicit knowledge sharing.
A larger pool of new contributors increases the potential inflow of individuals who can be mentored.
As new contributors skill up, they flow out of the 'New Contributors' stock into more experienced roles.
Developer turnover directly reduces the number of core developers by causing them to leave the project.
A higher promotion rate increases the core developer stock by moving experienced contributors into core roles.
A higher promotion rate decreases the stock of experienced contributors as they move into core roles.
The skill up flow increases the stock of experienced contributors by transitioning new contributors into this group.
Better explicit documentation accelerates learning, increasing the rate at which contributors skill up.
Effective mentorship accelerates practical skill development, increasing the rate at which contributors skill up.
Effective mentorship prepares experienced contributors for core responsibilities, increasing their promotion rate.
